title: Replace spinning_top with spin
body: The reason behind this change is discussed in #54. Since there is no activity in that PR, I am raising PR myself.

title: Update Nanorand to 0.6
body: This helps eliminate nanorand as a duplicate dep in upstream projects.

title: Fix `cargo clippy` warnings
body: This resolves the warnings provided by the `cargo clippy` command, improving the readability of the code in some parts.

title: Implement `Receiver`/`Sender` methods for `Future`, `Stream` and `Sink`
body: Fixes #80.

title: Fix compilation when `select` is only enabled feature
body:
Before:

```toml
# Cargo.toml

[dependencies.flume]
default_features = false
features = ["select"]
version = "0.10.2"
```

```console
$ cargo check
    Updating crates.io index
  Downloaded spinning_top v0.2.3
  Downloaded 1 crate (48.2 KB) in 1.84s
    Checking spinning_top v0.2.3
    Checking flume v0.10.2
error[E0432]: unresolved import `nanorand`
 --> /Users/aramis/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/flume-0.10.2/src/select.rs:4:5
  |
4 | use nanorand::RNG;
  |     ^^^^^^^^ use of undeclared crate or module `nanorand`

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0432`.
error: could not compile `flume`
```

This demo compiles without issue with this PR.

title: Link to methods that create async structs
body: Just a small docs addition that makes it easier to figure out how you create one of the async structs.

title: Bump outdated dev dependencies
body: The code changes is that `Rng::gen_range` now uses range syntax `a..b`.

title: Enable hung tests
body:
This might be fine after #69.
Closes  #44.

title: Fix nondeterministic bug in RecvSelection::deinit
body:
Using Arc::ptr_eq on trait object pointers can fail unpredictably because of https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/46139.

This can prevent a Hook from being removed when its RecvSelection is de-inited, which makes it incorrectly push Tokens to a queue owned by a Selector that no longer exists.

I found this bug using a test case provided by @scaphe in the Rust Users forum here: https://users.rust-lang.org/t/flume-question-possible-bug/55259

This may also be the cause of #44.

title: Fix issue #55
body: We need to just return `Poll::Ready` when there is no work to do in a send future. Closes issue #55.

title: Fix bug where new wakers would not be tracked
body: Incidentally, closes #33. This additionally changes the use of `Result<bla, T>` in `SendFut` to its own type, since it is less semantically confusing.

title: improve docs on error types
body: Closes #51. cc @joshtriplett do you think this phrasing is unambiguous enough or should it be changed in some way?

title: Remove unneeded Debug constraint from std::error::Error impl
body: This constraint prevented using any errors from a channel with non-Debug messages as `std::error::Error`. The constraint doesn't actually do anything anyway, since `std::error::Error` is implemented in terms of `Display`, not `Debug`.

title: Use nanorand over rand
body:
This refactors the `eventual-fairness` feature to use the [nanorand](https://crates.io/crates/nanorand) crate instead of [rand](https://crates.io/crates/rand), which is smaller and has no non-FFI unsafe code (no unsafe code at all with the `getrandom` feature)

Performance seems to be similar, although `cargo bench` had lots of noise seemingly so I can't tell for sure.

I'm concerned about init time - while using the `getrandom` feature of nanorand should improve init performance, and WyRand is extremely fast (8 GiB/s on my machine), _each call to_ `wait_inner` _initializes a new seeded RNG_. I don't want to touch the struct, as I'm scared that'd jostle the optimizer in a bad way.

title: Into send/recv async
body: This provides a way to send or receive a value from the channel with 'static lifetime, by consuming the sender or receiver. This corresponds to `into_sink` and `into_stream`, but for single send/receive operations.

title: Break up futures crate into futures_core and futures_sink
body: This removes unnecessary dependencies on futures_channel, futures_util, etc.

title: Misc additions to README and build config
body:
Things like:
* Exclude .github dir from cargo package file list
* Explicit set master as status branch for CI.

title: Implement into_{sink,stream} and make async methods return concrete types
body:
To do:
- [x] Fix stream impls (pre-existing issue in flume)
- [x] Stream tests
- [x] Figure out how the stream changes work with `eventual-fairness`

title: add async_no_double_wake test
body: We want a test to ensure flume doesn't make spurious calls to wake up the task, so this pr adds a unit test for it

title: Implement Select.wait_deadline
body: `wait_deadline` was just a copy of `wait_timeout`. I made a small change so that it actually implements a deadline. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/zesterer/flume/36)

title: Implement std::error::Error for all error types
body:
This makes the API more simmilar to std and shouldn't be a breaking change, since it has no impact on performance I don't see any reason to not have it.

For all the error types in lib.rs the error messages are directly taken from std. For the one in async.rs I had to come up with something and you might have better idea what the message should be there.

title: Move bin/perf.rs to examples
body:
Move to examples and tested it can run.
Fix #22

title: Add license files
body: Resolve #21

title: Complete refactor, adding different strategies for bounded/unbounded queues
body:
There are some things left to do:

- [x] Add flavours and blocking for senders and receivers
- [x] Fix `drain`
- [x] Fix `recv_timeout` and `recv_deadline`
- [x] Fix platform-specific things like the alternative mutex
- [x] Implement `Sync` for `Sender` and `Receiver` (is `thread_local!` a possible option?)
- [x] Get `select` working with the new implementation
- [x] Get `async` working with the new implementation
- [ ] Add the buffer optimisation for the mpsc case on unbounded queues (won't do, it doesn't permit `Sync`)

title: Async send & sink impl
body:
This PR adds a few things:
- An `async_send` method on `Sender` returning a `SendFuture`
- A `sink` method on `Sender` returning a `SenderSink` which borrows from that sender

Unresolved questions:
- Is it preferred to have to call a method to create a `SenderSink`, or should `Sender`s just implement `Sink`?
- Should `SenderSink` unconditionally borrow from `Sender`? Should there be an owned version? What about `SendFuture`. This probably also applies to `RecvFuture`

title: Add async exaple & split async integration tests
body:
* Provide simple async mpsc exmaple to help users know its APIs.
* Split the async tests to be more clear on what integration tests are
testing.

title: actions: Add multi-OS builds
body:
This PR added Actions build config for macOS, Windows, and their 32-bit versions.
Some timeout tests are disabled due to the timeout exceeded unexpectedly, 
the tracking issue is #41 .

title: Mutex, not spin on windows
body: Opening this for consideration. Greatly improves benches on windows, putting us ahead of crossbeam in most things, except for some of the robin ones.

title: Add stream impl to receiver
body: This adds an implementation of `futures::Stream` to the receiver. It adds a dependency (with no default features) on `futures`. If this crate were to be incorporated into `std`, then this piece of code could probably be removed, as the future of `Stream` is still (AFAIK) uncertain. However, it's a nice convenience impl for other users of this crate.

title: Added 32-elem buffer in receiver, reducing locking in some cases
body:
This adds a 32-elem [ArrayDeque](https://docs.rs/arraydeque/0.4.5/arraydeque/) buffer to the receiver, which is filled to its capacity or until there are no more messages upon each `try_recv`. This should help to reduce locking in some situations. In my benchmarks, the following changes were registered:

creation: +40%
hydra-1t 1000m: -37%
robin-u-32-1m: +4% (probably random variation)
robin-u-4t-1000m: -17%

Surprisingly (to me), hydra-32t-1000m did not change.

Because of the increase in creation time, this is feature gated, **but set as default.** That could be changed.

title: Reduce locking by moving set to waker after try_recv before returning pending
body: Title basically explains it. On xtra's [`crude_bench`](https://github.com/Restioson/xtra/blob/master/examples/crude_bench.rs) (xtra is a tiny, simple actor framework, and this bench is largely bottlenecked by the channel impl), this netted a 20ns improvement (120ns to 100ns) over flume without this change (but including the buffer change in #10).

title: Change how listen mode is updated and prevent drops
body:
- Changes listen mode from being incremented and decremented to being set to concrete values
- This solves a previous bug in master where some (<20 out of 50 million) messages would be dropped
- Added a test to make sure that in 100 million messages, no messages are dropped or reordered

title: Async
body:
This PR adds async support to flume

Still left to do (will be a followup PR or PRs):
- [x] Async receive method (this PR)
- [x] Stream impl (#11)
- [ ] Async send method to wait for enough capacity to be available
- [ ] Sink impl

title: Fix overflow on send_bounded test
body: The `sum` on `send_bounded` test will overflow with type `u32`

title: replace the `try_lock` loop with `lock`
body:
The code for sending looks like its just looping until the lock is available, with no further actions in between attempts.

Since `spin::Mutex` has API that does exactly that use case, this should simplify things.

title: Update example to use current API
